page.title: 10Bushey Hall Farm
page.content: Bushey Hall Farm is locat4d on swuare 05120197. The present early 18th Century farmhouse occupies the site of Bushey's earliest manor house which was recorded in the original Domesday Survey. It was a moated manor and the depression occupied by the moat is marked on the Ordnance Survey map of the area. During the 15th Century another manor was built on the site by the Earl of Salisbury. This was destroyed during the 17th Century. The present farm has a dairy herd, market gardening and runs a farm shop serving the local community.
